name: Radisson Blu Hotel Waterfront, Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern hotel. Big room with balcony right on the sea. Only stayed one night, and had to leave for a very early flight, so missed breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Will stay there again!! All 'mod cons' Very impressed. Free underground parking. Near V&A waterfront. Very quiet, except for the sounds of the waves....
reviews.title: Beautiful room, Right on the seafront.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay at the SAS Radisson. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with all our requests. The location to the V&A Waterfront (shopping, tons of dining options) was perfect and the hotel provides a shuttle bus to the waterfront every half hour. Our rooms were on the ocean side and the view was fabulous. We would defnitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay
GREAT LOCATION & VIEW
reviews.text: The sea views are fantastic. Rooms with sea view are worth the extra cost. The location is excellent, as it's easy to get to any part of Cape Town. The staff can be very good or really terrible, depending on their mood.. late check out was a problem, but we overcame that when I got angry!! Cabs are easy to get. The food was ok. The bar gets very busy early evening. The pool is not heated, which is fine on hot days, but could be dread at other times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loads of business types means that tourists get to use the pool at their leisure until 5ish, when the meetings stop!!
reviews.title: great place to stay

likes.liked: — good room size and very clean

reviews.text: On the whole it's a good 4 star hotel , but doesn't have the luxury, facilities or the service of a 5 star. Free wi-fi is a bonus for those who need to keep in touch.
reviews.title: Fablous hotel!!! Don't miss it while in Capetown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 nights at the end of May 2007 as the first stop on our African honeymoon.
reviews.title: perfect start to a honeymoon

likes.liked: — the size of the room and the view from our balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was outstanding. A stunning location right on the edge of the sea but within 500 yards of the V&A Waterfront which can be reached either on foot during the day or by the hotel shullt service in the eveings. The staff were professional, efficent and friendly. The buffet style breakfast was comprehensive and delicious, enhanced by the fact we sat on the terrace and took in some wonderful views whilst dining.
reviews.title: Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening, due to the aclaimed Tobbago's restaurant and the stunning sunsets, the terrace becomes quite lively as the locals gather to what is a reknowned hotspot for consuming a 'sundowner' or 2!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic location
Amazing
reviews.text: If you do one thing, splash out for a buisness class room. This gets you a sea view, a huge room and complementary breakfast which otherwise in £12 per head

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although 5 star, it manages to retain a more relaxed and less pretenious vibe which suited us perfectly.
reviews.title: First Class Experience

likes.liked: — Atmosphere, cleanliness and FIRST CLASS staff

reviews.title: Great start to South Africa Trip!
reviews.text: We stayed in the Radisson SAS Waterfront in June 07 for 3 nites. Like a previous reviewer, we managed to get our 3 nites free having booked 2 nites in Shamwari Game Reserve (thru Trailfinders)

Our room was lovely, pretty spacious and very clean. There was a very good buffet breakfast and the one dinner we had was very good. The hotel has a nice modern yet authentic feel to it. There is also a good business centre and souvenir shops in the hotel.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: What stood out for us though was the staff. They were incredibly friendly, helpful and genuine. The concierge was an absolute legend in recommending trips and tours and booking them for us. He seemed to have a permanent eye on Table Mountain for us, and was successful in getting us up there on a clear afternoon!..
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The regular free shuttle bus to the Waterfront was a nice bonus. The Waterfront was wonderful for shopping and some very nice restaurants.
reviews.title: Even better than expected!!

likes.liked: — Gorgeous sea views, proximity to V&A Waterfront, nice rooms

reviews.title: Perfect for cape town
reviews.text: All in all we had a wonderful time in the Radisson and would highly recommend it for a trip to Capetown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the new year (which is a busy period) as part of our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but a bit of an atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are great, the bar and restaurant and cool and the service good too. The outside area has fantastic views but not much of a pool and it was a bit crowded for doing any sunbathing (which suits me as it am of the pink skinned variety).
reviews.title: Great start to a holiday

likes.disliked: — Too expensive to stay too long! !

reviews.text: There are some great restaurants nearby and in the main town, although it is generally worth getting a taxi about the place as it is not too pleasant walking.
reviews.title: Don't go for New Year!

reviews.text: All in all a lovely hotel, perhaps with some limited facilities for the price. Very popular with the marina crowd.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Make sure you book a Business Class room
reviews.text: The Radisson was the first hotel of a one month holiday in South Africa and was an excellent start. The room [ mountain view] was large and well appointed although all montain view rooms overlook the entrance of the hotel aswell as the mountain! The rooms either face the sea or Table Mountain. The sea view rooms are considerably more expensive but have a fantastic view.

description: Uniquely located on the glittering azure waterfront of Cape Town, the hotel has the majesty of the legendary Table Mountain soaring behind it and every shopping and eatery delight beside it. It’s also a heartbeat away from Cape Town’s pulsing business centre, an easy stroll (or complimentary shuttle) to the famous Victoria & Alfred Waterfront with its myriad of world-class shops, restaurants, cinemas and colourful working harbour, or a short hop to Africa’s most beautiful beaches and the call of our lush and ancient winelands beyond. The state-of-the-art Cape Town International Convention Centre is a mere 5 minutes away.The Radisson Blu Hotel Waterfront provides the finest service, setting and comfort making your stay always one to remember and certainly one to repeat.
